dict.string: Use this section to define settings for FileVault 2

In macOS 10.9, you can use FileVault 2 to perform full XTS-AES 128 encryption on the contents of a volume. FileVault 2 payloads are designated by specifying com.apple.MCX.FileVault2 as the PayloadType value. Removal of the FileVault payload does not disable FileVault.
The human-readable description of this payload. This description appears on the Detail screen.
The human-readable name for the profile payload. The name appears on the Detail screen and doesn't need to be unique.

The reverse-DNS-style identifier for the payload. This identifier is usually the same as the TopLevel value, with an additional appended component. This string must be unique within the profile. During a profile replacement, the system updates payloads with the same 'PayloadIdentifier' and 'PayloadUUID' in the old and new profiles.
The payload type, which each payload domain's reference page specifies.

The globally unique identifier for the payload. The actual content is unimportant, but must be globally unique. In macOS, use 'uuidgen' to generate UUIDs. During a profile replacement, the system updates payloads with the same 'PayloadIdentifier' and 'PayloadUUID' in the old and new profiles.
The version of this specific payload.
The human-readable string containing the name of the organization that provides the profile. This value doesn't need to match the organization payload value in the enclosing dictionary.
If 'true', defers enabling FileVault until the designated user logs out. For details, see 'fdesetup(8)'. The person enabling FileVault must be either a local user or a mobile account user.
If 'true', enables a prompt for missing user name or password fields.
If 'true', creates a personal recovery key and displays it to the user.
If 'false', prevents display of the personal recovery key to the user after FileVault is enabled.
The path to the location where the recovery key and computer information property list are stored.
The DER-encoded certificate data if 'UseRecoveryKey' is enabled.
The UUID of the payload within the same profile containing the asymmetric recovery key certificate payload.
The user name of the Open Directory user to be added to FileVault.
The password of the Open Directory user to be added to FileVault. Use the 'UserEntersMissingInfo' key if you want to prompt for this information.
If 'true' and no certificate information is provided in this payload, the keychain created at '/Library/Keychains/FileVaultMaster.keychain' is used when the institutional recovery key is added.
Add institutional recovery key to keychain

The maximum number of times users can bypass enabling FileVault before being required to enable it to log in. If the value is '0', the user will be required to enabled FileVault the next time they attempt to log in. Setting this key to 'â€“1' disables the feature.
Maximum number of times FileVault can be skipped
If 'true', prevents requests for enabling FileVault at user logout time.

If 'true', and this payload is installed after enrolling with MDM in Setup Assistant, it requests Setup Assistant to enable FileVault at setup time. In this case, the system also ignores all other keys in this payload, except for 'ShowRecoveryKey'. To use this, enable the Await Device Configured DEP configuration option, send this profile with this key set, before sending the DeviceConfiguredCommand.
